unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Sparking Festive Cheer Across India**
normalised: Good news folks! Ahead of Diwali, the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E) is giving solar rooftop subsidies a serious push. Forget those hefty electricity bills – you could be generating your own power and even feeding it back into the grid!

unnormalised: Good news folks! Ahead of Diwali, the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) is giving solar rooftop subsidies a serious push. Forget those hefty electricity bills – you could be generating your own power and even feeding it back into the grid!
normalised: Under the revamped scheme, homeowners in cities like Chennai and Lucknow can get a subsidy of up to forty percent for rooftop solar plants up to three kilowatt. Larger installations also qualify for subsidies, though at a slightly reduced rate.

unnormalised: Under the revamped scheme, homeowners in cities like Chennai and Lucknow can get a subsidy of up to 40% for rooftop solar plants up to 3 kW. Larger installations also qualify for subsidies, though at a slightly reduced rate.
normalised: Think about it: enough power to run your A C and keep that fridge humming during those scorching summers, all while reducing your carbon footprint. Plus, you will be the envy of Sharmaji next door!

unnormalised: Think about it: enough power to run your AC and keep that fridge humming during those scorching summers, all while reducing your carbon footprint. Plus, you’ll be the envy of Sharmaji next door!
normalised: Experts at I I T-Delhi estimate a three kilowatt system could save you around rupee thirty thousand a year on electricity costs. That is a lot of biryani money!

unnormalised: Experts at IIT-Delhi estimate a 3kW system could save you around Rs. 30,000 a year on electricity costs. That's a lot of biryani money!
normalised: Local vendors are already reporting a surge in inquiries.

unnormalised: Local vendors are already reporting a surge in inquiries.
normalised: The government hopes this initiative will help achieve the ambitious target of forty gigawatt of rooftop solar capacity by two thousand and twenty six.

unnormalised: The government hopes this initiative will help achieve the ambitious target of 40 GW of rooftop solar capacity by 2026.
normalised: So, this festive season, why not gift yourself – and the planet – some clean, green energy? Check with your local electricity board for details and eligibility.

unnormalised: So, this festive season, why not gift yourself – and the planet – some clean, green energy? Check with your local electricity board for details and eligibility.
